New Records: Bryce Harper reached his 20th home run of the season, marking his ninth time achieving this milestone.
The Phillies had five players with 20 or more home runs, the third time since 2007.
Alec Bohm was close to becoming the first Phillie with 20 home runs this season.
Key Match Events: The Phillies came back from a two-run deficit to win the game.
Bryce Harper's home run in the second inning was a turning point.
Trea Turner's run-scoring grounder in the fifth inning was a key play.
Zack Wheeler's pitching performance improved his record to 4-0 in his last six starts.
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies were closing in on an NL wild card berth with a four-game lead over Arizona.
Manager Rob Thomson discussed evaluating relievers for playoff preparation.
Post-Match Reflections: Bryce Harper expressed gratitude for his recovery and performance.
Manager Rob Thomson highlighted the team's resilience and preparation for the playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was pushed back due to rain forecast but didn't affect the outcome.
Mets' Starling Marte was expected to rejoin the team soon despite a groin injury.
